intro: Selysia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf selysia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Oenotheraceae and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
